TO JUDGE bp bine 2018/KER/489 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 5" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners are accused Nos.i1 and 2 _ in C.C.No.781/2014 of the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court, Kayamkulam, based on Annexure-A3 final report in Crime No.960/2012 of the Kayamkulam Police Station for the offences under Section 420 read with 34 IPC. The allegation against the 1* petitioner is that she had offered to sell a petrol bunk, being conducted by her in a property, by claiming that she has every right over the property to convey, through Annexure-Al agreement. In Annexure-Al agreement she has agreed that she would make all the title holders of the property also as party to the sale deed. 2. According to the petitioners, who are the accused Nos.i and 2, they have every right to convey the property. The defacto complainant and his wife have been impleaded in the Crl.M.C. as additional respondents 2 and 3. The learned counsel for the said respondents submits that the defacto complainant has been deliberately cheated through bine 2018/KER/489 Cri.M.C.No.4594 of 2016 2 Annexure-Al agreement and the money has not been so far returned. It has been argued that the petitioners have no right to convey the property. 3. The present arguments forwarded by the learned counsel for the petitioners cannot be considered by this Court at this stage. Those matters have to be decided by the court below at appropriate stage. With liberty to the petitioners to take up all these contentions before the court below at the stage of framing charges under Section 239 Cr.P.C., this Crl.M.C. is disposed of. If the stage of Section 239 Cr.P.C. is over, the petitioners may take up all these contentions during trial. Sd/- B. KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE. ne // True Copy // P.A. to Judge
